required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tracking Results of Ablations to Combat AF Registry
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Patient Registry for Outcomes From Comprehensive Ablation Treatments of Atrial Arrhythmias

brief_summary.textblock: This is a global retrospective and prospective, multicenter, observational patient registry to record outcomes from patients undergoing ablations for the treatment of Atrial Fibrillation.

primary_outcome.measure: Long term effect of the ablation procedure
primary_outcome.description: Atrial Fibrillation lasting longer than 30 seconds as documented by long term event monitoring or identified during exam after a six month recovery period.
Adverse events occurred during the operation or post-operation.

intervention.intervention_name: AtriCure Isolator® Synergy™ Surgical Ablation System
intervention.description: The AtriCure Isolator® Synergy™ Surgical Ablation System is used in the Maze IV procedure for the treatment of Atrial Fibrillation.
The AtriCure AtriClip® LAA Exclusion System is used to exclude the Left Atrial Appendage.

study_pop.textblock: The TRAC-AF registry eligibility is open to sites and physicians performing Maze IV ablation procedures as treatments for patients diagnosed with paroxysmal, persistent or long-standing persistent atrial fibrillation using AtriCure Isolator® Synergy™ Clamp System and AtriCure AtriClip® LAA Exclusion System. Subjects must have been scheduled to undergo or have undergone the ablation treatment and must meet all eligibility criteria in order for their treatment and results to be considered for this registry.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient with a history of paroxysmal (intermittent), persistent or long-standing persistent atrial fibrillation and who have undergone or will undergo ablation treatment
- Patient >= 18 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject is enrolled in a concurrent study that has not been approved for concurrent enrollment by the global study manager
- Subject with exclusion criteria required by FDA or local governance
